location: Located at Orense cor. La Consolacion Street
about: The more habitable part of Guadalupe near the Poblacion and the swamplands lie at the doorstep of the army camp. It was very practical for the maimed, sick, homeless and desperate war victims to settle in the swamps and hills and wilderness of Guadalupe. They were to start life anew, and they called their new haven, Guadalupe Nuevo. The people who settled in Guadalupe Nuevo were industrious, hardworking, enterprising, foresighted and ambitious. They were soldiers, farmers, fishermen, traders, masons, carpenters, small-time businessmen and a stray of teachers and government and private company employees.  Through their combined efforts, they were able to resurrect a derelict barrio into one of the progressive places in Makati. Today, Guadalupe Nuevo is peopled by professionals, big-time businessmen, industrialists, political and civic leaders, retired soldiers and employees.
mission: We shall sustain the economic improvement and continued but maintained infrastructure, peaceful and healthy environs; coordinate with God-fearing, well-informed and enterprising residents empowering Barangay Guadalupe Nuevo as the center for commerce and development of District II, Makati City.
vision: To achieve our goals, we shall endeavor to mobilize citizen participation both in area of Economy and Peace and Order ensure that our barangay will be a livable place for people coming from other place, a safe haven for their place wherein they can realize their dreams by providing livelihood and encouraging people from the business sector to invest in worthwhile businesses.

feast_day.title: Feast of Our Lady of Immaculate Concepcion
Feast of Our Lady of Guadalupe

props.name: Slope Characteristics
props.value: Moderately undulating and rolling landsloping and many directions

props.name: Existing Land Used
props.value: The part of Guadalupe Nuevo lying along EDSA and Kalayaan Avenue are commercial areas while inner portions between EDSA and Kalayaan Avenue are most residential. The Tract of land from Kalayaan up to San Jose Creek is also residential.
